tasks.instruction:
Modify the enhanced dashboard frontend to connect to the user's existing FastAPI backend instead of using mock data. The backend has the following API endpoints:
- GET /api/summary - Returns total_feedback, sentiment_counts, urgency_counts, feedback_type_counts, platform_comparison, and trends
- GET /api/feedback - Returns feedback data with limit parameter
- GET /api/alerts - Returns alerts with urgency and feedback_type filters

Update the frontend components to:
1. Replace all mock data calls with actual API calls to these endpoints
2. Ensure the data structure matches what the backend provides
3. Add proper error handling for API calls
4. Maintain the modern UI design while using real data
5. Update the data fetching logic in Dashboard.jsx, FeedbackExplorer.jsx, and chart components
6. Add loading states and error handling for better UX
7. Ensure the authentication system still works with the real data integration

Fix the "Details" (eye icon) action button functionality in the FeedbackExplorer component. When users click the eye/details button for a feedback item, it should properly display the detailed information in a modal or expanded view. Ensure this works correctly with the real data from the FastAPI backend and provides a good user experience for viewing individual feedback details.

Update the FeedbackExplorer component to include username/sender name information in both the table display and the details modal. Check what username/sender fields are available in the backend data (such as 'username', 'sender', 'author', 'user', etc.) and display this information prominently. Add a new column in the feedback table for the username/sender and ensure it's also displayed in the details modal when viewing individual feedback items.
